Gene.FullName: PMS1 homolog 2, mismatch repair system component

RCVAccession.Title: NM_000535.7(PMS2):c.564dup (p.His189fs) AND Hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal neoplasms

GermlineClassification.ReviewStatus: criteria provided, multiple submitters, no conflicts

Citation.CitationText: American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics, Genomic Testing (Secondary Findings) ACT Sheet, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, PMS2, EPCAM Pathogenic Variants, Lynch Syndrome (Hereditary Non-polyposis Colon Cancer [HNPCC]), 2019
UK NICE Guideline NG151, Colorectal cancer, 2021
UK NICE Diagnostics Guidance DG42, Testing strategies for Lynch syndrome in people with endometrial cancer, 2020

Classification.Comment: For these reasons, this variant has been classified as Pathogenic. ClinVar contains an entry for this variant (Variation ID: 2098427). This premature translational stop signal has been observed in individual(s) with Lynch syndrome (PMID: 34178123). This variant is present in population databases (no rsID available, gnomAD 0.003%). This sequence change creates a premature translational stop signal (p.His189Thrfs*60) in the PMS2 gene. It is expected to result in an absent or disrupted protein product. Loss-of-function variants in PMS2 are known to be pathogenic (PMID: 21376568, 24362816).
